title: User management reports
content:
User Management Reports (UMR) can provide administrators with detailed reports of user role assignments and license usage.

To enable this feature, go to Administration > Configuration > Application Settings, then set the Enable User Management Reports setting to On.

When this feature is enabled, you can select Administration > People > User Management Reports to view the following information:

  • The people and the groups assigned with a particular role
  • The roles assigned to a particular person (either directly assigned or inherited from groups)
  • The list of licenses with usage information, start date, and expiration date
  • The list of users allocated with a particular license and the list of logged-in users
  •  The permissions to view the information in the PEOPLE, GROUPS, and ROLES tabs depend on whether you are assigned with corresponding role permissions. See Enable User Management Reports.
  • The information in the LICENSES tab is only available for users with tenant admin role.
  • Currently, User Management Reports only supports the English language.
  • Openl10n localization isn't supported for User Management Reports.

People

In the PEOPLE tab, you can view the roles and the licenses assigned to a particular person and the groups of this person.

Possible actions:

  • Use the filter bar to search for the particular users
  • Click a person record in the search results to view the detailed information:
    • The licenses assigned to him/her
      • Click on a license record to view detailed information of this license in the LICENSES tab
    • The roles assigned to him/her (either directly assigned or inherited from groups)
      • Click on a role record to view detailed information of this role in the ROLES tab
    • The groups including him/her
      • Click on a group record to view detailed information of this group in the GROUPS tab
    • Click BACK to exit and go back to the PEOPLE tab
    • Click VIEW DETAILS to view detailed information of this person record in Service Management.
    • Click EXPORT TO EXCEL to export the contents in the current page into an Excel file.
    • Click ∨ or > to collapse or expand contents

Group

In the GROUPS tab, you can view the roles assigned to a particular group and the people included in the group.

Possible actions:

  • Use the filter bar to search for the particular groups
  • Click a group record in the list to view the detailed information:
    • The roles assigned to this group
      • Click on a role record to view detailed information of this role in the ROLES tab
    • The people included in this group
      • Click on a person record to view detailed information of this people in the PEOPLE tab
    • Click BACK to exit and go back to the GROUPS tab
    • Click VIEW DETAILS to view detailed information of this group record in Service Management.
    • Click EXPORT TO EXCEL to export the contents in the current page into an Excel file.
    • Click ∨ or > to collapse or expand contents

Roles

In the ROLES tab, you can view the people and the groups assigned with a particular role.

Possible actions:

  • Use the filter bar to search for the particular roles
  • Click a role record in the list to view the detailed information:
    • The people assigned with this role
      • Click on a person record to view detailed information of this people in the PEOPLE tab
    • The groups assigned with this role
      • Click on a group record to view detailed information of this group in the GROUPS tab
    • Click BACK to exit and go back to the ROLES tab
    • Click EXPORT TO EXCEL to export the contents in the current page into an Excel file.
    • Click ∨ or > to collapse or expand contents

License

In the LICENSES tab, you can view the license list and further view the list of users allocated with a particular license and the list of logged-in users.

  • ID: License ID
  • APPLICATION: Application activated by this license
  • MODEL: The edition (Express or Premium) and access type (Concurrent user or Named user) of the license.
  • CAPACITY: Number of total available licenses
  • ALLOCATED: Number of users allocated with this license
  • LOGGED IN: Number of currently logged-in users
  • START DATE: Start date of the license
  • EXPIRATION DATE: End date of the license

Possible actions:

  • Click the HIDE EXPIRED button or the SHOW EXPIRED button to hide or show the expired licenses in the list
  • Click a license in the list to view the detailed information:
    • ALLOCATED USERS (N): The list of users allocated with this license
      The (N) number next to "ALLOCATED USERS" is the number of users allocated with this license
      The  icon indicates this user is currently logged in.
      When the licenses are added in the System use definitions > License field of a Person record, this person will be listed in ALLOCATED USERS for this license.
      The allocated licenses can be either manually assigned by admin users or automatically assiged by the system.
      • Click on a person record to view detailed information of this people in the PEOPLE tab
    • LOGGED IN USERS (A/B): The list of logged-in users
      The (A/B) ratio next to "LOGGED IN USERS" indicates the number of logged-in users and the total license capacity. For example, 25/100 indicate that 25 users are currently logged in, out of a total of 100 available licenses.
      • Click on a person record to view detailed information of this people in the PEOPLE tab
    • Click BACK to exit and go back to the LICENSE tab
    • Click EXPORT TO EXCEL to export the contents in the current page into an Excel file
    • Click VIEW USAGE DATA to check the license consumption
      The license information is automatically recorded according to the schedule that runs every 30 minutes. The report records the number of users using this license at the end of the 30-minute interval, not the maximum number of users during that interval. 
    • Click REFRESH to synchronize the latest data and information
    • Click ∨ or > to collapse or expand contents
